actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Foreign Affairs.
Reported to House from the Committee on Foreign Affairs, H. Rept. 93-970.
Measure laid on table in House.

official_title: Resolution: An inquiry into the military alert invoked on October 24, 1973.

summary.text: Directs the Secretary of State to submit to the House of Representatives within ten days after the adoption of this resolution certain specified information, including the following: (1) the text of all diplomatic messages in the possession of the Secretary of State or the Department of State received from Leonid Brezhnev, General Secretary of the Persidium of the C.P.S.U. Central Committee of the Union of Soviet Socialist Republics, or from any other official of the Union of Soviet Socialist Republics, to the President of the United States, which were delivered on October 24 or 25, 1973; (2) the text of diplomatic messages sent by the President of the United States, and in the possession of the Secretary of State or the Department of State, as replies to any of the diplomatic messages referred to in paragraph (1); and (3) a list of actions, communications, and certain readiness measures taken by the Soviet Union which were referred to in the following statement made by the Secretary of State on October 25, 1974.: u"And it is the ambiguity of some of the actions and communications and certain readiness measures that were observed that caused the President at a special meeting of the National Security Council last night, at 3 o'clock antemeridian, to order certain precautionary measures to be taken by the United States."

titles.title: Resolution: An inquiry into the military alert invoked on October 24, 1973.
